intro: Symphorema glabrum, commonly known as the smooth symphorema, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae, which includes eucalyptus and other aromatic plants. The plant is characterized by its small, white or pale pink flowers that appear in clusters. Its leaves are simple, alternate, and often have a smooth texture. Symphorema glabrum typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and is often found in coastal or semi-arid regions.
